newsitem.title: UK: Next slips on "disappointing" sales news.
newsitem.headline: Next slips on "disappointing" sales news.

text.p: Shares in Next Plc were indicated 15p lower at 585p by 0720 GMT as the market expressed disappointment with the retailer's sales at the start of the second half of the year, analysts said.
The company said retail sales in the first five weeks from August 12 rose 14 percent, but that figure was inflated by new store openings.

"The increase in sales is a lot slower than people were expecting," said Nick Bubb, retail analyst at MeesPierson. He said the market had expected Next to receive a bigger boost from Britain's warm summer.
"It looks like the competition might have benefited slightly more from the hot weather than they have," he said.
The company also reported a first-half pre-tax profit of 56.0 million stg and a dividend of five pence per share, above a market consensus of 54.42 million and 4.6 pence respectively.
